intro: Smicrostigma viride, commonly known as the green-stemmed smicrostigma, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often releasing a subtle scent when crushed. Smicrostigma viride is valued for its ornamental appeal and is occasionally used in traditional herbal medicine.
